u wedge u = ______ for any vector u.

o: The Lie algebra of traceless nxn matrices

What is homological algebra about?
o: Study of chain complexes, exact sequences, and derived functors

q: A sequence A -> B -> C is exact at B if im(A -> B) = ker(B -> C).

o: An ideal of the source ring

q: The First Isomorphism Theorem: R/ker(f) is isomorphic to im(f).

o: The derived functor of Hom, measuring extensions of A by B

q: Tor(A, B) is the derived functor of the ______ product.

What is category theory?
o: Study of mathematical structures and their relationships via objects and morphisms

q: A category consists of objects, morphisms, and ______ of morphisms.
Every morphism has an identity morphism on its domain and codomain.
What is a functor?
o: An object that is both initial and terminal

q: Match the category theory concept with its definition:

What is an adjunction between functors?
o: A pair of functors with natural bijection between hom-sets

q: Left adjoints preserve ______.
Right adjoints preserve limits.
What is the Yoneda lemma about?
o: Objects are determined by their morphisms from/to other objects
Categories can be embedded in Set

What is a representation of a group?
o: A homomorphism from the group to GL(V) for some vector space V

q: The dimension of a representation is the dimension of the vector space V.
A representation is ______ if it has no proper non-zero subrepresentations.
Schur's Lemma states that morphisms between irreducible representations are either 0 or isomorphisms.
What is the character of a representation?
o: The trace of the representing matrices as a function on the group

q: Characters are constant on ______ classes.

o: Uniqueness of composition series factors up to order and isomorphism

q: A composition series is a maximal chain of ______ subgroups.

o: Every such group is a direct sum of cyclic groups

q: Z x Z_2 x Z_3 is isomorphic to Z x Z_6.

right: Order of subgroup divides group order

q: A p-group is a group whose order is a power of the prime p.

What are Sylow theorems about?
o: Existence, conjugacy, and number of maximal p-subgroups

o: Study of commutative rings and their modules

q: An ideal P is prime if ab in P implies a in P or b in P.

What is the Nullstellensatz about?
o: Correspondence between ideals and algebraic varieties

A ring that is a field
A ring with no zero divisors

In characteristic p, a perfect field has bijective Frobenius.

o: An integer a such that x^2 = a (mod n) has a solution

q: The Legendre symbol (a/p) = 1 if a is a quadratic residue mod p.

The ______ function counts integers up to n that are coprime to n.

What is the Chinese Remainder Theorem about?
o: System of congruences with coprime moduli has unique solution

q: If gcd(m, n) = 1, then Z_mn is isomorphic to Z_m x Z_n.

A complex number with integer parts

q: The algebraic integers in Q are exactly Z.

What are units in a ring of integers?
o: Elements with multiplicative inverses in the ring

o: Upper bound on norms of ideal class representatives

o: An integrally closed Noetherian domain where every non-zero prime is maximal

o: An ideal measuring ramification, inverse of the codifferent

o: The maximal unramified abelian extension of a number field

o: A discrete subgroup of R^n isomorphic to Z^n

q: The fundamental domain of a lattice has volume equal to det(B) for basis matrix B.

What is a p-adic number?
o: An element of the completion of Q with respect to p-adic absolute value

q: The p-adic integers Z_p are the unit ball in Q_p.

Q_p is locally compact as a topological field.
What is the p-adic exponential?
o: The usual power series, converging on a smaller domain in Q_p

o: Ring of infinite power series F[[x]] with formal operations

q: F[[x]] is a local ring with maximal ideal (x).

q: The idele group is the unit group of the adele ring.

What is a scheme in algebraic geometry?
o: A locally ringed space locally isomorphic to Spec of a ring

q: Spec(R) is the spectrum of prime ideals of ring R.

o: A continuous map with compatible sheaf morphism

q: Rearrange scheme concepts from basic to advanced:
A variety is a reduced scheme of finite type over a field.

o: Topology where closed sets are zero sets of polynomial ideals
